trans-unit.source: Step 7: Test the Solution
trans-unit.target: Step 7: Test the Solution

trans-unit.source: This topic in the tutorial lists the steps to test the solution by sending messages with different quote amounts to the endpoint where the <token>request_response</token> is deployed.
trans-unit.target: This topic in the tutorial lists the steps to test the solution by sending messages with different quote amounts to the endpoint where the <token>request_response</token> is deployed.

trans-unit.source: The tutorial uses the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> tool to send messages to the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The tutorial uses the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> tool to send messages to the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The tool is available with the sample package is available at <externalLink><linkText>MSDN Code Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=252395</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The tool is available with the sample package is available at <externalLink><linkText>MSDN Code Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=252395</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The solution must be tested by sending messages with different schemas and messages that have quote amount less than or greater than $10000.
trans-unit.target: The solution must be tested by sending messages with different schemas and messages that have quote amount less than or greater than $10000.

trans-unit.source: So, the <embeddedLabel>SampleData</embeddedLabel> folder within the package includes the following sample request messages that you can use to test the solution.
trans-unit.target: So, the <embeddedLabel>SampleData</embeddedLabel> folder within the package includes the following sample request messages that you can use to test the solution.

trans-unit.source: ACORD1_RequestMesssage_SmallAmount.xml
trans-unit.target: ACORD1_RequestMesssage_SmallAmount.xml

trans-unit.source: Compliant with ACORDRq1.xsd
trans-unit.target: Compliant with ACORDRq1.xsd

trans-unit.source: QuoteAmount = $1000
trans-unit.target: QuoteAmount = $1000

trans-unit.source: ACORD1_RequestMessage_LargeAmount.xml
trans-unit.target: ACORD1_RequestMessage_LargeAmount.xml

trans-unit.source: Compliant with ACORDRq1.xsd
trans-unit.target: Compliant with ACORDRq1.xsd

trans-unit.source: QuoteAmount = $15000
trans-unit.target: QuoteAmount = $15000

trans-unit.source: ACORD2_RequestMessage_SmallAmount.xml
trans-unit.target: ACORD2_RequestMessage_SmallAmount.xml

trans-unit.source: Compliant with ACORDRq2.xsd
trans-unit.target: Compliant with ACORDRq2.xsd

trans-unit.source: QuoteAmount = $1000
trans-unit.target: QuoteAmount = $1000

trans-unit.source: ACORD2_RequestMessage_LargeAmount.xml
trans-unit.target: ACORD2_RequestMessage_LargeAmount.xml

trans-unit.source: Compliant with ACORDRq2.xsd
trans-unit.target: Compliant with ACORDRq2.xsd

trans-unit.source: QuoteAmount = $15000
trans-unit.target: QuoteAmount = $15000

trans-unit.source: To send a message to the <token>bridge</token>
trans-unit.target: To send a message to the <token>bridge</token>

trans-unit.source: Locate the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> project in the sample package and build it.
trans-unit.target: Locate the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> project in the sample package and build it.

trans-unit.source: Use the resulting <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> command-line executable (under \bin\Debug folder within the project) to send messages to the deployed <token>bridge</token> endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Use the resulting <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> command-line executable (under \bin\Debug folder within the project) to send messages to the deployed <token>bridge</token> endpoint.

trans-unit.source: This tool accepts command-line parameter in the following format:
trans-unit.target: This tool accepts command-line parameter in the following format:

trans-unit.source: Where,
trans-unit.target: Where,

trans-unit.source: Parameter name
trans-unit.target: Parameter name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: ACS Namespace
trans-unit.target: ACS Namespace

trans-unit.source: The Access Control namespace for the <token>af_integration</token> deployment.
trans-unit.target: The Access Control namespace for the <token>af_integration</token> deployment.

trans-unit.source: IssuerName
trans-unit.target: IssuerName

trans-unit.source: Issuer Name for the specified namespace
trans-unit.target: Issuer Name for the specified namespace

trans-unit.source: IssuerKey
trans-unit.target: IssuerKey

trans-unit.source: Issuer Key for the specified namespace
trans-unit.target: Issuer Key for the specified namespace

trans-unit.source: RuntimeAddress
trans-unit.target: RuntimeAddress

trans-unit.source: Runtime address or the endpoint URL where the <token>bridge</token> is deployed.
trans-unit.target: Runtime address or the endpoint URL where the <token>bridge</token> is deployed.

trans-unit.source: MessageFilePath
trans-unit.target: MessageFilePath

trans-unit.source: Path to the file that contains the sample request message.
trans-unit.target: Path to the file that contains the sample request message.

trans-unit.source: ContentType
trans-unit.target: ContentType

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, set this parameter to <embeddedLabel>application/soap+xml</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, set this parameter to <embeddedLabel>application/soap+xml</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt and navigate to the solution where you built the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> project.
trans-unit.target: Open a command prompt and navigate to the solution where you built the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> project.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to send the request message that has quote amount less than $10000:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to send the request message that has quote amount less than $10000:

trans-unit.source: Because <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceA</embeddedLabel> processes messages with quote amounts less than $10000, go to the command prompt for the service.
trans-unit.target: Because <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceA</embeddedLabel> processes messages with quote amounts less than $10000, go to the command prompt for the service.

trans-unit.source: If the service receives the message successfully, you must see the following message displayed on the console:
trans-unit.target: If the service receives the message successfully, you must see the following message displayed on the console:

trans-unit.source: The text indicates that the service received the message from the <token>bridge</token> and that the message is saved at the given location.
trans-unit.target: The text indicates that the service received the message from the <token>bridge</token> and that the message is saved at the given location.

trans-unit.source: Go to the location where the message is saved and open the message XML file.
trans-unit.target: Go to the location where the message is saved and open the message XML file.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the message includes the following header:
trans-unit.target: Notice that the message includes the following header:

trans-unit.source: You had configured the <token>bridge</token> to add the <embeddedLabel>QuoteType</embeddedLabel> custom header in the section <link xlink:href="5780b286-e997-4b09-8217-9ebe1103a5b4#BKMK_RouteAction" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Include Custom Headers in the Message</link>.
trans-unit.target: You had configured the <token>bridge</token> to add the <embeddedLabel>QuoteType</embeddedLabel> custom header in the section <link xlink:href="5780b286-e997-4b09-8217-9ebe1103a5b4#BKMK_RouteAction" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Include Custom Headers in the Message</link>.

trans-unit.source: Now, send the request message where quote amount is greater than $10000.
trans-unit.target: Now, send the request message where quote amount is greater than $10000.

trans-unit.source: Type the following on the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> command prompt:
trans-unit.target: Type the following on the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> command prompt:

trans-unit.source: Because <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceB</embeddedLabel> processes messages with quote amounts less than $10000, go to the command prompt for the service.
trans-unit.target: Because <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceB</embeddedLabel> processes messages with quote amounts less than $10000, go to the command prompt for the service.

trans-unit.source: If the service receives the message successfully, you must see the following message displayed on the console:
trans-unit.target: If the service receives the message successfully, you must see the following message displayed on the console:

trans-unit.source: Once again, go to the location where the request message is saved.
trans-unit.target: Once again, go to the location where the request message is saved.

trans-unit.source: This time, notice that the value of the <embeddedLabel>QuoteType</embeddedLabel> header is set to <embeddedLabel>LargeAmounts</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: This time, notice that the value of the <embeddedLabel>QuoteType</embeddedLabel> header is set to <embeddedLabel>LargeAmounts</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In both the cases, whether you send a request message with a smaller quote amount or a larger quote amount, a message is displayed on the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> console as well:
trans-unit.target: In both the cases, whether you send a request message with a smaller quote amount or a larger quote amount, a message is displayed on the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> console as well:

trans-unit.source: Go to the location where the response messages are saved and open the two messages.
trans-unit.target: Go to the location where the response messages are saved and open the two messages.

trans-unit.source: Notice the following in the two messages:
trans-unit.target: Notice the following in the two messages:

trans-unit.source: Both the response messages have the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatusCd</embeddedLabel> element in the message body and its value is set to <embeddedLabel>Success</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Both the response messages have the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatusCd</embeddedLabel> element in the message body and its value is set to <embeddedLabel>Success</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: You had extracted this value from the response message header and passed it on to the response message body as part of the procedure <link xlink:href="9e498d62-bcd2-447d-b209-bfc044b9f5f5#BKMK_ResP_Enrich" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To extract and promote properties in the pre-transform Enrich stage</link>.
trans-unit.target: You had extracted this value from the response message header and passed it on to the response message body as part of the procedure <link xlink:href="9e498d62-bcd2-447d-b209-bfc044b9f5f5#BKMK_ResP_Enrich" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To extract and promote properties in the pre-transform Enrich stage</link>.

trans-unit.source: Both the response messages have the following header included:
trans-unit.target: Both the response messages have the following header included:

trans-unit.source: You had configured the <token>bridge</token> to add this custom header in the section <link xlink:href="9e498d62-bcd2-447d-b209-bfc044b9f5f5#BKMK_Reply" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To configure the reply action</link>.
trans-unit.target: You had configured the <token>bridge</token> to add this custom header in the section <link xlink:href="9e498d62-bcd2-447d-b209-bfc044b9f5f5#BKMK_Reply" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To configure the reply action</link>.

trans-unit.source: Finally, both the response messages have two other custom headers as well, <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Eligibility</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Finally, both the response messages have two other custom headers as well, <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Eligibility</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The relay service adds these headers as part of the response message.
trans-unit.target: The relay service adds these headers as part of the response message.

trans-unit.source: While the value of <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> is set to <embeddedLabel>Success</embeddedLabel> in responses from both the services, the value of <embeddedLabel>Eligibility</embeddedLabel> varies depending on which service sent the response:
trans-unit.target: While the value of <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> is set to <embeddedLabel>Success</embeddedLabel> in responses from both the services, the value of <embeddedLabel>Eligibility</embeddedLabel> varies depending on which service sent the response:

trans-unit.source: Response from <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceA</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: Response from <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceA</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Includes the header with value set to <embeddedLabel>ApprovedForSmallAmounts</embeddedLabel>:
trans-unit.target: Includes the header with value set to <embeddedLabel>ApprovedForSmallAmounts</embeddedLabel>:

trans-unit.source: Response from <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceB</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: Response from <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceB</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Includes the header with value set to <embeddedLabel>ApprovedForLargeAmounts</embeddedLabel>:
trans-unit.target: Includes the header with value set to <embeddedLabel>ApprovedForLargeAmounts</embeddedLabel>:

trans-unit.source: Because both the responses are sent back the same message sender client, you can use the <embeddedLabel>Eligibility</embeddedLabel> header to determine whether the response came from <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceA</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceB</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Because both the responses are sent back the same message sender client, you can use the <embeddedLabel>Eligibility</embeddedLabel> header to determine whether the response came from <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceA</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceB</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Repeat steps 2 and 3 by sending messages that are compliant with ACORDRq2.xsd.
trans-unit.target: Repeat steps 2 and 3 by sending messages that are compliant with ACORDRq2.xsd.

trans-unit.source: In the response messages that the client receives, notice that an additional node (<embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel>) is included.
trans-unit.target: In the response messages that the client receives, notice that an additional node (<embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel>) is included.

trans-unit.source: You configured the <token>bridge</token> to extract this element from the request message in the procedure <link xlink:href="a4bf9e02-cac7-4bc8-b842-735294a240b8#BKMK_ReqP_Enrich" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To extract and promote properties in the pre-transform Enrich stage</link> and then configured the <token>transform</token> to pass the extracted value to the response message in the procedure <link xlink:href="1442290a-8fca-42c6-97c4-7e3bb4e55344#BKMK_TransformRes2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To map NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs2.xsd</link>.
trans-unit.target: You configured the <token>bridge</token> to extract this element from the request message in the procedure <link xlink:href="a4bf9e02-cac7-4bc8-b842-735294a240b8#BKMK_ReqP_Enrich" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To extract and promote properties in the pre-transform Enrich stage</link> and then configured the <token>transform</token> to pass the extracted value to the response message in the procedure <link xlink:href="1442290a-8fca-42c6-97c4-7e3bb4e55344#BKMK_TransformRes2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To map NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs2.xsd</link>.
